subject: Mental Health
title: Phobias Explained
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Phobias Explained.

hook.text: A grown adult screams at a tiny spider. The fear is real, intense, and instant.

buildup.text: Specific phobias are extreme fears of objects or situations posing little real danger.

discovery.text: The brain forms a fear memory so strong that logic cannot override it.

twist.text: Some phobias, like fear of snakes, may be hardwired from evolution.

climax.text: Over 12 percent of adults will experience a specific phobia in their lifetime.

punchline.text: The mind treats a harmless trigger like a predator.

quiz.question: Why might some phobias be partially hardwired?
